text.Node10:
I hope that doesn't sound boring to you.

It's honestly quite entertaining once you get into it, well... 
In MY opinion anyway. Take that for what it's worth I guess.
text.Node11:
Also... This is not a "funny" game.

This might seem funny, because you kinda caught me off guard, 
and I'm not used to this... 
But no, the game is not like that really. 

It's quite serious... oh and ADULT!
text.Node1112: Hello there. you must be Zack! The apprentice!
text.Node12:
I mean... It's not like an adult game or anything...

But it contains some pretty adult themes, 
and is not appropriate for children, 
so you know.... trigger warning and all that.
text.Node13:
Ok, that's about it. What else... No I think that's all...

No wait, I forgot...
text.Node1305: Woman that runs the General Store.
text.Node14:
Nice to meet you.
My name is Thack.
text.Node1605: Mr Johes is a suspect for the Murder.
text.Node1606:
Mr. Traversteen, Husband to Tylda. 
Died a year ago due to, seemingly natural causes.
text.Node1904: Yeah, that's me. I've been told to investigate the murder.
text.Node1905: Yes sir, I am. I have been told to ask you some questions sir. About the mayor.
text.Node1906: Sure. Did you kill the Mayor!?
text.Node1907:
The Priest told me you would. What a shock. I was not the one to find the body, but I was in there. By the Gods, who, WHAT could do such a thing!?
It was as if he burst from within, spewing his insides out!
text.Node1908: Really. Well, good look to you young man. I saw the body, not a pretty sight. I can't imagine what did that.
text.Node1909:
WHAT!? NO I DID NOT!
Who told you that!? Was it the Priest? Did he accuse me? Just because I never go to confession he does not trust me!
text.Node1910: In anycase, I'm sure you have questions.
text.Node1911: Maybe you should investigate this properly instead.
text.Node2: You need to press Spacebar to continue.
text.Node202: Speaking of which... I've got some books to read.
text.Node203:
I don't have time to read all of them, one would do for now.
But you have to help me pick.
text.Node204:
They are supposed to help me get better at conversations, 
and... you know... speaking to people. 
I guess I can be kind of shy...
text.Node205: I suppose it's something that might come in handy... who knows.
text.Node2209: When did you see the body?
text.Node2210: Did you know the Mayor well?
text.Node2211: Can you think of anyone that could have done this?
text.Node2212: Wait, you don't go to confessions? Ever? Why not?
text.Node2213: I still think you did it! No one else is big enough to tear him apart like you did!
text.Node2214:
I went up there after the Priest came by and told me...

On his description I thought maybe a bear had wandered into town, but no bear did that. I cannot imagine what could have done that kind of damage to a man.

Perhaps Magic. I saw it's use during the war, magic could have done it.
text.Node2215:
I would say so yes.

I've known him as long as anyone here, save perhaps the Widow von Duren, but I've certainly known him better. I imagine I will be talking at the funeral. Unless someone from his family comes up from the Capitol, but I doubt it. His brothers family lives there, but he passed away ten years ago, and they are not in touch.
text.Node2216:
I've been thinking about that. 

I can only imagine someone came in from the outside. A wagrant perhaps. 

I don't know, it is a strange thing.
text.Node2517: Magic? What do you mean Magic?
text.Node2518:
Magic boy. It's real. Not wives-tales about walking 7 times through a door at sunset on midsummer eve, but spells and books, staves and wands.

Though it's only in the hands of the nobels of course. I have never heard of anyone using magic that was not a noble. But wizards do exist, and magical weapons and armor, passed down through generation among the the noble families.

I've seen spells that commanded balls of fire and strikes of lightning, as well as strange spells with destructive effect.

I might as well tell you about it. It was during the war.
text.Node2520: As you I'm sure you know 5 years ago the war on the eastern steppes ended.
text.Node274:
Hello there Thack.
Did you finish your reading?
text.Node276:
I did. I picked the one with the Jokes.   
Not sure how useful puns and one-liners would really be, but it was a fun read.
text.Node277: Yeah... ehm... I read the one about... Love and stuff.
text.Node278:
No, didn't read any book.
No, I'm lying, I read the one about... lying.
text.Node279:
Ah yes, the Compendium of Witty Retorts.    
Do no underestimate the value of some levity, Thack, even in dire circumstances.
It has the ability to bring out the most closed person. 
You will need people to feel like they trust you when you talk to them. Some humor goes a long way to achieve comity.
text.Node280:
Ah Yes, the Lovers Guidebook to Love. 
Do not be ashamed of the subject matter, young Thack, it is only natural to be curious about such things. Even for men of the cloth, like you and me.

It is an important, essential, and beautiful part of the human experience and well worth studying.
text.Node281:
Mhm, the Art of Telling Lies. 
Understand Young Thack, that we serve the community we work in, we are their humble servants and guides. Sometimes that requires a more complex relationship with the truth than we might like. 

But do not try to lie to me, it will never work. I would not be in the position I am if I could not discern lie from truth.
text.Node282:
Thack... There is no easy way to say this. There has been a murder.
And I need you, to investigate the murder on my behalf.
text.Node3:
Nice! Ok, here we go. Welcome to the Game!
Wow! I never really thought anyone would actually play this...
text.Node31:
I want to tell you more, but, let's go to my room first.
Its the door on the left there.

And the only door that is going to work because... 
Well as I said... this is a tutorial.
text.Node4:
Damn, this is wrong... sorry.
I'm terrible at this.
text.Node432:
You have chosen to read the book, the Lovers Guide to Love.

This book have given you insigt into how a gentleman approaches the fairer sex, as well as how gentlemen discuss the subject among themselves.

This is useful to approach characters that care a lot about this subject, and to recognize when love might be on someones mind.
text.Node433:
You have chosen to read the book the Compendium of Witty Retorts.

This book has prepared you with jokes, puns and witticisms to use in conversation to gain levity and lighten the mood.

This is useful for characters that are very closed-in and hard to approach, as well as characters that enjoy humor and a good joke.
text.Node434:
You have chosen to read the book the Art of Telling Lies.

This book explains how to get away with telling lies, and making untrue things up on the spot.

This is usefull in all situations. As long as the person you are talking to acutally believes you.
text.Node5:
Ok... This is the tutorial for the game. 
Right... tutorial... lets do this!
text.Node6:
Ok, so you can move using the WASD keys, as you do in most games.

You can also use the movement keys... but I'm not sure why you would want to...
text.Node64:
Ok, so.. 
I'm an apprentice to Father Djonsicus here in the Church.
text.Node65:
I'm new here, but this village is... 
I don't actually remember the name of the Village.. 
Sorry. As I said, I'm new, I just arrived a few days ago actually.
text.Node66:
Anyway, there is not a lot of people in the village at the moment, 
most are away at some festival I believe. 
And I've mostly been doing chores and required reading.
text.Node7:
I don't know. Maybe you like using the movement keys instead of the WASD keys.

That's up to you.. I don't... it really has nothing to do with me.
You can use either, its fine... really.
text.Node752:
WHAAAAT!! WHO...!! WHY ME????

Are you serious? I must be the least qualified person for this job in the entire Village. I literally don't know anyone! I can't even remember the name of this place.
text.Node753:
Wait, someone got killed?
Who, and how? Are you certain it was murder?

There are not that many people in the village, if someone did this that person could not be far.
text.Node754:
Yes! This is exactly the kind of thing I have been waiting for!

Thank you for trusting in me sir. I will not let you down, I was born for this!
text.Node755:
Calm down Thack, this is a serious situation.
A man is dead, and it does not look accidental. This has not happened here since... well, it's been awhile.

You are the perfect person to investigate Thack, simply BECAUSE you do not know anyone. You are the only person I can trust had no part in this.
text.Node756:
This is a small village, everyone here knows everyone else.
When something like this happens, it is likely many, if not everyone here knows at least something about it.

It is also just as likely that everyone will make up their own theories and use it as justification to accuse anyone that feel have slighted them in some way or other.
text.Node757:
I need you to be the impartial witness. Ask everyone, about everything, but keep a polite tounge, and try to consider what people are telling you.

People rarely say what they truly mean, if you are to unravel this mystery, you will need to hear what they are not saying, and I think you can do just that.
text.Node758:
Good, you react as I had hoped. With curiosity, not emotion.

This is why I want you to handle this investigation. Tyford has not had a murder since... Well it's been awhile. Suffice it to say our Village will be torn once people get back from the festival in Brountown. If you can get to the bottom of what happened before then we can focus on comforting those affected, not have everyone accuse each other wildly.
text.Node759:
I'm not sure, why can't you do it?

They would be far more likely to tell you truth then me.
text.Node760: Alright, go on. Who is the victim?
text.Node761: No, I cannot. I take confessions, as such I cannot reveal what is told to me in confidence.
text.Node762: I understand, please go on, who is the victim?
text.Node763: Wait a minute, if you take confessions, then you should already know who the murderer is, at least have some knowledge of who MIGHT have done it!
text.Node764:
Thack, confessions is a divine sacrament. In confessions I am a vessel for the Gods themselves, betraying that trust, directly or indirectly is something I will never do.

Let it go Thack. You have other things to focus on.
text.Node766: Also our Village is called Tyford. As you should well know.
text.Node767:
The victim is our mayor, Mayor Dellry. He died during the night, in a most... gruesome manner.

You will have to see the body yourself, I am sorry Thack, I cannot spare you this. You will find him in his office, in the second floor of his home.
text.Node768: Thack, this is no time for sarcasm. A man is dead.
text.Node769:
Mayor Dellry has been killed.

His body can be found in his home, on the second floor, in his office.

Everyone in the village can be asked about this card.
text.Node8:
Ok, moving around, easy right?

Secondly the rest of the game... 
So this is an RPG, it really is.
But, its probably different from games you've played before.
text.Node9:
I mean. There is no combat here, this game is about... 
you know... dialogue... talking to people. 
Thinking about what they say, and so on...
text.Node937: I'm sorry. I don't know why I even said that. Who died?
text.Node939:
Oh no sir. I am totally serious.
I truly believe I was called for this. This is perhaps the most exiting thing that has ever happened to me. I am ready! I
text.Node940:
Well ok Thack. Your enthusiasm is helpful, if surprising.
This is the most harrowing crime we have seen here in Tyford since... Well, it's been awhile.
text.Node941:
Talk to the other villagers, the few that are not away at the Harvest festival in Brountown. I have alerted the few that are here. Now I must write a letter for the Township, and prepare the funeral arrangements.

You are on your own from now on Thack. The Village is not large, you will find your way around.
text.Node942:
I have one advice for you.

When you talk to people do not be too rude, but also do not be too polite.
A murder investigation is a serious affair, do not hold yourself to propriety, nothing matters more than solving this.
